jobDescription: is to gather, analyze and interpret research data for clinical research projects in the Collaborative START Laboratory. This position's responsibilities in the Collaborative START lab will be organized around 3 work areas: 1) design, build and manage databases, 2) provide research and technological support to lab directors, managers and project coordinators 3) manage online recruitment and marketing including maintaining the 2 websites . This position has the responsibilities of developing recommendations based on research findings, research instrumentsREQUIRED--Experience interacting with and collecting sensitive information from clinical research subjects and maintaining confidentiality--Strong data management and experience in accurately developing and maintaining electronic files; experience preparing reports --Experience with cross-site coordination and collaboration on data related tasks--Thorough knowledge of IRB process--Demonstrated strong interpersonal skills to interact tactfully and diplomatically with a diverse group of people including faculty, staff and students--Excellent organizational skills to work under frequent interruptions; experience with independently establishing priorities, and working with deadlines--Experience working with a great deal of flexibility in a fast-pace working environment--Excellent oral and written skills to communicate with faculty, staff, students and the public--Bachelor's degree in related area or equivalent combination of experience and trainingSPECIAL REQUIREMENT - THIS POSITION MAY BE SUBJECT TO A CRIMINAL BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION, DRUG SCREEN, LIVE SCAN FINGERPRINTING, MEDICAL EVALUATION CLEARANCE, AND FUNCTIONAL CAPACITY ASSESSMENT
